sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"做，执行，实施，完成"之意。
means: perform ： 指完成困难较大、较复杂的任务。较正式用词。
conduct和perform一样比较正式，二者意义相近，但conduct含指导、领导或监督等意味。
do ： 最普通常用词，指完成某项具体工作、任务，也指完成某种行为或动作。
execute ： 指需专门技术熟练技巧去完成某种复杂的任务或表演等，也指用行动把计划或打算付诸实施或执行某项命令。
fulfil ： 指履行和实现所许诺的、所期望或要求的事情，含最终完成的意味。

sentence.Network_en: He can perform an astonishing variety of acts, including mime and juggling.
sentence.Network_cn: 他能表演好几种令人惊叹的把戏，包括哑剧和玩杂耍。

sentence.Network_en: The group perform variations on soul and gospel music.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个乐队演奏灵歌和福音音乐的变奏曲。

sentence.Network_en: "State-owned industries will always perform poorly," John Moore informed readers.
sentence.Network_cn: “国有企业经营不善将是常态，”约翰·穆尔告诉读者。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French parfourmer, alteration (by association with forme 'form') of Old French parfournir, from par 'through, to completion' + fournir 'furnish, provide'

entry.tran: 做，执行，履行（尤指复杂的任务或行动）
entry.def: When you perform a task or action, especially a complicated one, you do it.

example.ex: We're looking for people of all ages who have performed outstanding acts of bravery, kindness or courage...
example.tran: 我们正在寻找那些见义勇为、乐于助人、勇气可嘉的人，年龄不限。

example.ex: His council had had to perform miracles on a tiny budget...
example.tran: 他的委员会不得不以极少的预算去创造奇迹。

entry.def: If something performs a particular function, it has that function.

example.ex: A complex engine has many separate components, each performing a different function.
example.tran: 一个复杂发动机有很多独立零部件，每个零部件具有不同作用。

entry.def: If you perform a play, a piece of music, or a dance, you do it in front of an audience.

example.ex: Gardiner has pursued relentlessly high standards in performing classical music...
example.tran: 加德纳一直不懈地追求古典音乐演奏的高水准。

example.ex: This play was first performed in 411 BC...

entry.tran: （人）表现良好/很差；（事物）运转良好/糟糕
entry.def: If someone or something performs well, they work well or achieve a good result. If they perform badly, they work badly or achieve a poor result.

example.ex: He had not performed well in his exams...
England performed so well against France at Wembley...
example.tran: 在温布利球场上，英格兰队表现出色，击败了法国队。

means.word_mean: 1. carry out or perform an action;

sentences.sentence: "John did the painting, the weeding, and he cleaned out the gutters"
"Horowitz is performing at Carnegie Hall tonight"
"We performed a popular Gilbert and Sullivan opera"

auth_sentence.content: When we perform like today I'm very angry.
auth_sentence.res_content: When we perform like today I'm very angry.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: When we perform like today I'm very angry.

auth_sentence.content: You have to perform to stay at the top.

Sentence.sentence: Well, to continue, as I mentioned earlier, there is also research that demonstrates that individuals perform worse, not better on tasks when other people are there.
Social psychologist, John Roberts, finally cleared up the confusion about why people sometimes perform better and sometimes worse in front of an audience
The research argued that boys often perform badly in mixed schools because they become discouraged when their female peers do better earlier in speaking and reading skills.
Government's failure to perform this role in the early 1930s transformed recession into depression.
A supervisor's action toward a poorly performing worker can affect the attitudes of other employees.
Supervisors should acknowledge high performance so that the employee will continue to perform well in the future.

sentences.en: He not only promised, but performed.
sentences.cn: 他不仅许下诺言, 而且做到了。

sentences.en: He always performs his duties faithfully.
sentences.cn: 他一贯忠实地履行自己的职责。
他在压力之下表现得很好。

sentences.en: They performed a dance for the children.
sentences.cn: 他们为儿童表演了一个舞蹈。

sentences.en: The doctor performed the operation yesterday.
sentences.cn: 昨天大夫进行了一例手术。

sentences.en: Our team performed very well in the yesterday's games.
sentences.cn: 在昨天的运动会上我们队表现出色。

sentences.en: The team performs under a circus tent.
sentences.cn: 这队在马戏团帐篷下演出。

jushi.english: Although she had never been interviewed on TV before, she performed well.
jushi.chinese: 尽管她以前从未接受过电视采访,但却表现得十分自然。

jushi.english: All of the musicians performed admirably.
jushi.chinese: 乐师们都演得极其出色。

jushi.english: He not only promised, but performed.
jushi.chinese: 他不仅许下诺言,而且做到了。
